pullRequest.title: Track GET/LIST Azure Storage API calls
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adds tracking for the API calls performed by the Azure Storage
underlying SDK. A new interface (RequestMetricCollector) has been
introduced into the Azure plugin that allows collecting metrics per
request easily, it just need to be injected in during the client
creation and it would be hooked into the OperationContext.

nodes.bodyText: I'm thinking about moving this class (that's shared across the 3 repositories) into org.elasticsearch.common.blobstore. Additionally I would use an Enum instead of using a String to represent the operation type. wdyt? We could get rid of some duplication.

Adds tracking for the API calls performed by the Azure Storage
underlying SDK. A new interface (RequestMetricCollector) has been

Track GET/LIST Azure Storage API calls

nodes.bodyText: These are https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/get-blob-properties requests right? I'm not sure about the cost impact of these (would have to research that in more detail) but I would suggest we just track them as a separate counter for now and investigate that later instead of dropping them?

Maybe we should just keep this logic in AzureBlobStore and simply add the listener to the requests that we meter just like we do in S3 (we can just add a utility for it contex + RequestMetricCollector in -> context out). Having this here with two separate methods for getting the client tuple is much harder to follow isn't it?
If we kept this in AzureBlobStore as suggested above then this and NO_OP wouldn't be needed I think, making things much simpler.

+ * KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permissions and limitations
+ * under the License.
+ */
+
+package org.elasticsearch.repositories.azure;
+
+/**
+ * A listener that can be hooked into any Azure Storage request allowing metric collection
+ */
+interface RequestMetricCollector {
+
+    /**
+     * Used to collect metrics after a successful request/response cycle
+     *
+     * @param requestMethod HTTP request method
+     */
+    void collectMetrics(String requestMethod);
+
+    /**
+     * Used to collect metrics after a failed request/response cycle
+     *
+     * @param requestMethod the HTTP request method
+     * @param statusCode the response status code
+     */
+    default void collectMetricsForFailedRequest(String requestMethod, int statusCode) {}
+
+    default boolean isEnabled() {

commit.message: Simplify how metric collector is hooked into OperationContext

nodes.bodyText: Since we didn't actually implement the failed request counting (for now at least), maybe just use a Consumer<String> where this is used and simplify it away for now (I think we can just collect the failures to some string key as well if we want to do that going forward)?
